New Records: Ronald Acuña Jr. became the first player in the majors to steal 70 bases and hit 40 home runs in a season.
Key Match Events: Ozzie Albies drove in Acuña with a 10th-inning single that clinched home-field advantage for the Braves.
Acuña stole two bases in the game, adding another slice of history to his unprecedented season.
Post-Match Reflections: Acuña said it was an incredible moment and one of those numbers that wasn't impossible but seemed impossible.
Braves manager Brian Snitker said, ‘Hopefully we can take that into the postseason.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game saw a rally from the Braves, overcoming deficits of 3-1, 4-3, and 5-4.
Ronald Acuña Jr. scored the winning run on a diving headfirst slide into home plate.
Others: The crowd of 37,246 pushed the Braves over 3 million in attendance for the second season in a row and eighth time in team history.
